text.div: No narrative is provided for definitional resources. A human-readable rendering can be found in the implementation guide(s) where this resource is used.

name: ZibAbilityToEat
title: zib AbilityToEat
description:
Being able to independently prepare and consume food is part of self-care. Limitations in this ability indicate a reduced ability to cope for oneself.
This activity and activities such as those including drinking, getting dressed and bathing are also known as activities of daily living (ADL). These are the activities people go through in daily life. The extent to which a person is able to do all these activities by themselves is a measure for their total ability to do things independently.
purpose: This Observation resource represents the Dutch [zib ('Zorginformatiebouwsteen', i.e. Health and Care Information Model) AbilityToEat v3.1.1 (2020)](https://zibs.nl/wiki/AbilityToEat-v3.1.1(2020EN)).

element.comment: The EatingLimitations concept (NL-CM:4.7.4) is represented using distinct Observation resources, using profile [zib-AbilityToEat.EatingLimitations](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-AbilityToEat.EatingLimitations). It is referenced from this resource using `Observation.hasMember`.

element.definition: Feeding oneself: bringing food to the mouth and feeding oneself until satisfied.
The EatingLimitations concept (NL-CM:4.7.4) of zib AbilityToEat, represented as a distinct Observation resource.
